Articles.Content:
The pictures do all the talking.

http://imgur.com/a/11GjM

What's happening here is that you land the Kerbal on the upward-facing thrusters, and activate them at full throttle for a second to send the Kerbal up into the air at incredible speeds. I calculated the Kerbal's launch speed to be about ~467m/s, which is enough to escape Minmus but not the Mun. I just used conservation of energy to calculate initial velocity (Ui+Ki=Uf+Kf). I am also a physics major

My next goal is to launch a Kerbal from Minmus back into Kerbin's atmosphere. Has anyone else tried anything similar?
I've seen Danny2462 (on youtube) use a heavily modified engine to do it, and HOC gaming and TheMattDennis have done it in their challenging youtubers series.

that isn't interstellar.
Interstellar means between two solar systems. Not planets/moons.
why don't you use mailsails? They're more than twice as powerful. You could also escape the mun's SoI

I haven't tried one yet using mainsails. Why? Because with this current design, when you flick on the power for that brief period of time, the whole structure flexes, and when you shut the engines back off, it "springs" back into position; which often results in the cannon going airborne.

With some small modifications; it could definitely be done in such a way that you could use mainsails without that deadly flexing.
With a modified engine and a lot of precision, this could become both a cool way to add crew to ships and a deadly weapon. Jeb just found another way to bust stations!
With Vanguards EVA parachutes this would be super handy.
Profanity-evading necroposts nibbled, troublesome undead thread now properly dead. Make a new one guys, and less of the st*rs please.
